intro: Corydalis temolana, commonly known as the Himalayan Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant has slender, branched stems and produces small, oval-shaped leaves. Corydalis temolana is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high altitudes. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture, though it is sensitive to environmental conditions.
